rev.comment: /* Philanthropy */ fair use image not mentioned in prose; unnecessary to convey meaning; fails [[WP:NFCC]]
rev.diff:
Line 66: Line 66:
===Philanthropy===
===Philanthropy===
â
<!--The image "Alesha Dixon premier" can only be used in the philanthropy section because of its copyright rationale; it cannot be used merely for identification purposes. Thank you.-->
  â
[[File:Alesha Premier.jpg|thumb|right|200px|Dixon in a photoshoot for the [[National Blood Service]], encouraging members of the [[Black British|Black]] and [[British Asian|Asian]] community to give blood and join the British Bone Marrow Registry]]
 
In 2009 Alesha climbed [[Mt Kilimanjaro]] in Tanzania for [[Comic Relief]]. Joining her on the climb were [[Girls Aloud]] members [[Cheryl Cole]] and [[Kimberley Walsh]], [[Ben Shephard]], [[Gary Barlow]], [[Ronan Keating]], [[Fearne Cotton]], [[Denise Van Outen]], and [[Chris Moyles]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Lizzie Smith |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1160068/On-world-Joy-Cheryl-Alesha-reach-summit-Mount-Kilimanjaro.html |title=On top of the world: Joy as Cheryl, Alesha and co reach the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2009-07-03 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}</ref> Together they raised over Â£3,500,000 towards helping combat [[malaria]] in [[Tanzania]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8387848.stm |title=Fearne Cotton and Kimberley Walsh return to Africa |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2009-12-01}}</ref> The whole team met [[Gordon Brown]] at [[10 Downing Street]] <ref>{{cite web|author=Post to: |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/latest/2009/03/15/tea-with-pm-for-kilimanjaro-nine-115875-21200451/ |title=Tea with PM for Kilimanjaro nine |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date=2009-03-15 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}</ref> Dixon had previously been to Downing Street just months before the climb to meet with [[Sarah Brown (spouse)|Sarah Brown]] in honour of the [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] ultimate women of the year awards.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Lizzie Smith |title=Don't worry Gordon... I'm here to see Sarah! Sex And The City's Kim Cattrall visits Downing Street|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1083575/Dont-worry-Gordon-Im-Sarah-Sex-And-The-Citys-Kim-Cattrall-visits-Downing-Street.html|work= |date= November 6, 2008|accessdate= }}</ref> While discussing the malaria issue in Tanzania Dixon said,
In 2009 Alesha climbed [[Mt Kilimanjaro]] in Tanzania for [[Comic Relief]]. Joining her on the climb were [[Girls Aloud]] members [[Cheryl Cole]] and [[Kimberley Walsh]], [[Ben Shephard]], [[Gary Barlow]], [[Ronan Keating]], [[Fearne Cotton]], [[Denise Van Outen]], and [[Chris Moyles]].<ref>{{cite web|author=Lizzie Smith |url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1160068/On-world-Joy-Cheryl-Alesha-reach-summit-Mount-Kilimanjaro.html |title=On top of the world: Joy as Cheryl, Alesha and co reach the summit of Mount Kilimanjaro | Mail Online |publisher=Dailymail.co.uk |date=2009-07-03 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}</ref> Together they raised over Â£3,500,000 towards helping combat [[malaria]] in [[Tanzania]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/entertainment/8387848.stm |title=Fearne Cotton and Kimberley Walsh return to Africa |publisher=BBC News |date=2009-12-01 |accessdate=2009-12-01}}</ref> The whole team met [[Gordon Brown]] at [[10 Downing Street]] <ref>{{cite web|author=Post to: |url=http://www.mirror.co.uk/celebs/latest/2009/03/15/tea-with-pm-for-kilimanjaro-nine-115875-21200451/ |title=Tea with PM for Kilimanjaro nine |publisher=mirror.co.uk |date=2009-03-15 |accessdate=2009-07-12}}</ref> Dixon had previously been to Downing Street just months before the climb to meet with [[Sarah Brown (spouse)|Sarah Brown]] in honour of the [[Cosmopolitan (magazine)|Cosmopolitan]] ultimate women of the year awards.<ref>{{Cite news|author=Lizzie Smith |title=Don't worry Gordon... I'm here to see Sarah! Sex And The City's Kim Cattrall visits Downing Street|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-1083575/Dont-worry-Gordon-Im-Sarah-Sex-And-The-Citys-Kim-Cattrall-visits-Downing-Street.html|work= |date= November 6, 2008|accessdate= }}</ref> While discussing the malaria issue in Tanzania Dixon said,
